title: Ticket #7132: submit-1.chtc schedd downed by EVENT_LOG_MAX_SIZE
description:
The schedd on submit-1.chtc.wisc.edu fell over when it tried to rotate the global event log: 

06/27/19 14:28:44 (pid:2730829) (D_ALWAYS:2) WriteUserLog Created rotation lock
/var/lock/condor/EventLogLock @ 0x2cadbd10
06/27/19 14:28:44 (pid:2730829) (D_ALWAYS|D_FAILURE) ERROR "Invalid expression
for EVENT_LOG_MAX_SIZE (64Mb) in condor configuration.  Please set it to an
integer expression in the range -2147483648 to 2147483647 (default 1000000)." at
line 2183 in file /slots/21/dir_3881073/userdir/.tmpcW4KF4/BUILD/condor-
8.9.3/src/condor_utils/condor_config.cpp

Of course, after it came back up, it tried to update the global event log again, and crashed again.

  1. As requested by Moate, this knob, and MAX_HISTORY_LOG, should accept the usual set of suffices.
  2. These knobs should probably be param_longlong(), instead.
  3. The schedd should (also) check these knobs at start-up, not (only) at log rotation time.
